image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump's face as he looks over his shoulder with a casual expression.

props.synopsis: The Pentagon is reviewing the AUKUS security pact between Australia, the UK and the US to ensure it meets Donald Trump's "America First" agenda, a US defence official has told the ABC.

title.children: US launches review into AUKUS submarine deal to ensure it's 'America First'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Press Club speech

props.synopsis: A potential in-person meeting between Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and US President Donald Trump is still anticipated, but senior sources told the ABC it was too soon to be "definitive" and there were "lots of moving parts".

title.children: Albanese-Trump meeting in limbo as Israeli cabinet sanctions trigger US rebuke

image.altText: A man in a suit holds a sunscreen bottle.

props.synopsis: Sunscreen testing by CHOICE finds many popular brands don’t meet their SPF claims, but experts say sunscreens remain safe and effective.

title.children: Only four of 20 popular sunscreens passed CHOICE's SPF testing

image.altText: A woman stands in a room with bookshelves behind her. She is looking up and has her hands on her hips.

props.synopsis: After a second embryo mix-up at Monash IVF, activists say "rare mistakes" are systemic failures and urge families to get DNA tests.

title.children: Parents urged to DNA test kids after second IVF error revealed

image.altText: Mitchell Starc shouts to celebrate a wicket.

props.synopsis: Australia's searing seam attack takes four late wickets to put the mace holders on top of South Africa after day one of the World Test Championship final at Lord's.

title.children: Aussies blow away South African top order in nine-wicket final session

image.altText: Brian Wilson, Mike Love, Dennis Wilson, Carl Wilson, David Marks from band The Beach Boys pose with a surfboard

props.synopsis: Wilson's ear for melody, arrangements and wide-eyed self-expression inspired Good Vibrations, California Girls and other summertime anthems, making him one of the world's most influential recording artists.

title.children: Brian Wilson, co-creator of the Beach Boys, dies aged 82

image.altText: A man with long stubble wearing a white shirt, blue suit and tie looks at something out of frame while sitting down

props.synopsis: Harvey Weinstein, who was once one of the most powerful figures in Hollywood, was accused and is now guilty of sexually assaulting a former production assistant.

title.children: Harvey Weinstein guilty of sex crime charge after mixed verdict in retrial

image.altText: A close-up of hands filling a vaccination syringe with liquid from a vile.

props.synopsis: The federal government has revealed plans to tackle declining childhood vaccination rates with the launch of a new immunisation plan.

title.children: New immunisation plan to tackle drop in childhood vaccination rates

image.altText: Solar panels installed on a roof

props.synopsis: More than 8 million solar panels will be decommissioned annually in the coming years, as batteries drive the next solar wave. With only about 10 per cent of panels recycled, waste is a major issue, with many stockpiled, sent overseas or ending up in landfill.

title.children: Millions of panels dumped as solar upgrades rise

image.altText: The front of a vehicle parked in a bay with a prominent shiny T badge.

props.synopsis: As Elon Musk departs the White House and shifts his attention back to Tesla, he's now facing the fury of Australian drivers who are suing the electric car company over faults including phantom braking.

title.children: Thousands of 'terrified' Australian drivers join class action against Tesla

image.altText: A man being held on the ground by police with his arms being held behind his back.

props.synopsis: Demonstrations against Immigration and Custom Enforcement actions are planned across the US in coming days as opposition to the Trump administration's immigration raids grows.

title.children: Protests spread to more US cities after Los Angeles unrest

image.altText: Two men at press conferences wear suits and stand outside.

props.synopsis: After a nail-biting few days of "will they, won't they, could they, should they," Tasmania's very, very early election is full steam ahead. And whoever wins on July 19 owes voters a better effort than the last parliament.

title.children: Election called, but both Liberals and Labor hamstrung on key issues

image.altText: A wide shot of a Palestinian city shows rubble, dust and two Israeli military vehicles travelling down roads.

props.synopsis: At least 41 Palestinians were killed by Israeli gunfire and air strikes in the Gaza Strip on Wednesday, most of them at a central aid site operated by the US- and Israeli-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, local health officials said.

title.children: Israeli fire kills 41 in Gaza, many close to aid site, officials say

image.altText: A sign says "Toowong Private Hospital".

props.synopsis: The family-owned mental health facility has been under financial pressure and went into administration last month.

title.children: Struggling hospital bought artwork from its own director for $300K

image.altText: danmei product 2

props.synopsis: Police in China are arresting female authors of homosexual romance novels, in a widespread crackdown on the "boys love" fiction genre.

title.children: Writers 'anxious' after police arrest 'boys love' novelists in China

image.altText: Seven TV hosts all smiling warmly wearing reasonably formal clothing with a blue, pink and orange background

props.synopsis: The end of The Project "signals the end of so much more" says host Waleed Aly, who says the show will leave a hole in the television landscape "that won't be filled".

title.children: 'Astonished I got to do this': The Project host reflects on show's axing

image.altText: White football, labelled "A-Leagues 2024/25," lying beside a white boundary line on a grass pitch.

props.synopsis: The professional soccer players' association calls for gambling on yellow cards to be banned in the wake of the A-League's second match fixing scandal in 12 months.

title.children: Soccer players demand ban on betting on yellow cards

image.altText: Portrait of a woman runner resting on a grey day.

props.synopsis: Shorter days and chilly mornings can make regular exercise even more challenging during the colder months.

title.children: What exercise and health experts say about wintering

image.altText: A large fire in a storage complex, cars in the foreground

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to a storage facility at Burpengary just after 6pm.

title.children: One person hospitalised after large fire Brisbane storage facility

image.altText: A man posing in front of a green bush

props.synopsis: Edwin Kumar was named alongside Australia's most wanted man as a tech master involved in unwittingly giving criminals bugged phones. Now he is free and back in Sydney.

title.children: Tech whiz deported back to Sydney from US over AN0M bugged phone sting

image.altText: Elon Musk wears a black baseball cap that says 'DOGE'.

props.synopsis: Mr Musk claimed without evidence that the government was concealing information about the president's association with infamous paedophile Jeffrey Epstein.

title.children: Elon Musk says he regrets 'some' social media posts about Trump

image.altText: A low angle of Trump looking up at an overcast sky

props.synopsis: The US will allow Chinese students to study at universities and colleges in America under the deal, but Mr Trump says the agreement is subject to final approval by him and Chinese President Xi Jinping.

title.children: Donald Trump says US will get rare earths from China under new deal

image.altText: A small dragon-like lizard with green and dark green scales and yellow and white highlights, but no earhole.

props.synopsis: The home of the only wild population of Victorian grassland earless dragons is no longer viable as a private farm, but governments are unwilling to buy the land for conservation.

title.children: Once thought dead, this lizard faces extinction from land sale limbo

image.altText: Cooper the beaglier by the fire in stanthorpe

props.synopsis: The weather divide between Queensland's north and south sharpens as cold temperatures set in below the Tropic of Capricorn.

title.children: 'Bikinis and speedos' in the north as Queensland's south frosts over

image.altText: a young boy in blue uniform standing in front of a school bus

props.synopsis: More than 20 years after Western Australia mandated seatbelts on all school buses, the rest of the country still allows children to travel unrestrained, often at highway speeds.

title.children: Parents fear 'tragedy waiting to happen' without school bus seatbelts

image.altText: Dirt covered tree roots pulled out of the ground by a storm, fallen onto a green fence.

props.synopsis: Brisbane's council failed to keep hundreds of thousands of its trees in good condition, raising the risk of damage to property or infrastructure, an internal review shows.

title.children: Nearly 20,000 trees in 'poor condition' in Brisbane, review finds

image.altText: A green glowing mushroom against a pitch black background

props.synopsis: Each year, eco-tourists head to South Australia's south east to spot rare mushrooms, but drought conditions have slowed their growth along with that of other wild fungi.

title.children: Ghost mushroom season off to slow start on SA's south east

image.altText: A a look inside terminal at Western Sydney Airport

props.synopsis: Despite Western Sydney International Airport being on track to open in late 2026, clarity on two stumbling blocks remain up in the air.

title.children: First look inside Australia's newest international airport as issues remain

image.altText: The GrainCorp factory in Numurkah emitting smoke.

props.synopsis: Numurkah residents launch a class action against manufacturer GrainCorp Oilseeds, alleging noise and odour pollution that residents say has affected their health and wellbeing.

title.children: Class action alleges noise and odour pollution by small town's main employer

image.altText: Two men at press conferences wear suits and stand outside.

props.synopsis: This snap election may well end 11 years of Liberal government in Tasmania. But in a state with a history of long-running Labor governments, it's far from clear if this election will usher in a new era of stable politics.

title.children: Will this election herald new era of stable politics? Don't bet on it

image.altText: A sketch of a woman with long brown hair in a purple top frowning in front of a cream backdrop.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson has told a Supreme Court jury that she fed her children the leftovers of a deadly beef Wellington lunch despite experiencing diarrhoea after eating it.

title.children: Accused killer Patterson fed children leftovers despite illness, court told

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.

props.synopsis: Victorian Liberal MP Moira Deeming offers to delay bankruptcy proceedings against former leader John Pesutto if the opposition party bypasses its rules and guarantees her preselection for next year's state election.

title.children: Deeming offers to delay Pesutto bankruptcy proceedings for preselection

image.altText: A singer and fellow performers on stage at the Cabaret Fringe Festival

props.synopsis: The final curtain has come down on two Adelaide festivals, who say more needs to be done to support the second level of South Australia's entertainment calendar.

title.children: Money woes force Adelaide festivals to shut
